Okay i Deleted the another ::master and putted it up to the Playercommands.
I got 1 error.

Cant Paste the CMD-Compile Error so heres a Pic.

[/quote]
the error say you have A MISSING [size=36pt];[/size]
In the sentence
public void playercommands(client c, String playerCommand)
just put a ;
now command look like:
public void playercommands(client c, String playerCommand)[size=36pt];[/size]
BY The picture this should fix your ERROR[/quote]

Dude you’re retarded, it means he has a missing bracket and it thinks that’s supposed to be a plain declaration instead of a block of code inside of it.

EDIT: And the only reason he screwed up his playerCommands class is because he was too damn retarded to follow a loveing tutorial that I wrote out for him basically.

And I don’t support spoon-feeding, so go ahead and convince him to post it yourself.

item.title: ::master
item.dc:creator: @Aesyr Aesyr
item.description:
@Aesyr wrote:

[quote=“Lirimoo, post:34, topic:467057”]Listen.
At my Adminstrator Commands there arent on ::master NO playerrights.
there the code

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("master")) { for (int i = 3; i < 25; i++) { c.playerLevel[i] = 99; c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); } c.getPA().requestUpdates(); }[/quote]

Alright, screw it. Here you go, cut the whole damn command out where you find it, and go find this:

public void playerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) {

Once you find that, paste your ::master command after that part of the code.

EDIT: AND MAKE SURE THE COMMAND IS REMOVED FROM WHERE IT WAS BEFORE.

Let me explain it to you:
Your ::master command is in the administratorCommands section. There is also a playerCommands, moderatorCommands, and ownerCommands section.

By doing what I told you, you have moved the command from the administratorCommands section to the playerCommands section of all of your commands.

These sections are grouped together so that the coder only has to type out the playerRights == 2 ONCE and then take all of the commands from that group and make them require that they are administrators.

So every command within the administratorCommands section requires administrator rights, and every command inside the playerCommands section requires no rights.

You should have something like this in your commands file:

if (c.playerRights >= 0) playerCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 1 || c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3) moderatorCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3) administratorCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 3) ownerCommands(c, playerCommand);

That means that if you’re an owner (playerRights == 3) then you have access to the ownerCommands section of the commands. This also means that only people with the rights level of 3 can access these commands.

It also means that if you’re NOT an owner (playerRights == 3) all of the commands in that section become unavailable to you.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: ::master
item.dc:creator: @Aesyr Aesyr
item.description:
@Aesyr wrote:

The solution is to copy the command into the playerCommands section instead of the administratorCommands section.

Currently it is listed under administratorCommands and therefore people with playerRights 2 and 3 are given access to the whole section of commands through this:

if (c.playerRights >= 0) playerCommands(c, playerCommand); //moderator commands if (c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3) administratorCommands(c, playerCommand);

Simply go find where playerCommands starts, and copy the ::master command into that and remove it from the administratorCommands section (or it will have duplicates and do weird shit to your server).

Read full topic

That doesn’t help because his command is already within a code block.

if (playerRights >= 0} {

//::yell, ::home commands here etc.

} else if (playerRights >= 1) {

//::ban, ::mute etc. moderator commands here

} else if (playerRights >= 2) {

//::update, ::master etc. admin commands here

}

We want to move ::master up in the file next to yell so it’s no longer among the admin commands.
